<Very well, my lord.> Empath betrays some disappointment through her 
mental voice.  (It's a habit of hers not to use her comm under normal 
circumstances; telepathy is much more difficult to eavesdrop on.)

The Seeker increases her speed to maximum and soon reaches 
headquarters.  If it's that important, then she has no wish to 
delay.  Still, the whispering voices remain at the back of her mind, 
and that bothers her.  If there is indeed someone on this world with 
that kind of power, it is of grave concern to everyone involved.

Changing to robot mode, she walks inside, wondering what her 
unpredictable commander was up to now.

(OOC: Lurker, before you get any ideas, this has nothing to do with 
Skullertron.  Her mental powers are every bit as potent and refined 
as his, and she could block out his influence at will.)

--- In nbwrpg@y..., aerosmith60@c... wrote:
>  Galvatron was startled by the entrance of his mind. "No there is 
no time for 
> that now. We will investigate it later."
